content.raw:
I did some `printf`'s and I found that on Ubuntu, the blue value is always 255, while the b, g values are changing between the light and dark lines, so I think this logic needs to change some. I tried the following, but it makes `darkBlueTransition` equal to 3 instead of 2, maybe because of anti-aliasing?

~~~
diff -r 286df818fb9c gazebo/gui/LaserVisualization_TEST.cc
--- a/gazebo/gui/LaserVisualization_TEST.cc	Sun Nov 29 02:23:48 2015 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/gui/LaserVisualization_TEST.cc	Mon Nov 30 12:22:51 2015 -0800
@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@
     // check if current pixel is blue, prev pixel is also blue
     // and the two shades of blue are different
     if (r == g && r < b && rPrev == gPrev && rPrev < bPrev &&
-        r < rPrev && b != bPrev)
+        r < rPrev && (b != bPrev || r != rPrev))
       ++darkBlueTransition;
 
     // check if current and prev pixels are the same blue color
~~~
